meanings.definition: Gain or acquire (something) again through effort or work.
meanings.sent1: After losing his job, he had to reearn the trust of his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: She had to reearn her driver's license after it expired.
meanings.sent3: The student had to reearn his teacher's approval by working hard in class.
meanings.sent4: She had to reearn her spot on the team after being injured.
meanings.sent5: He had to reearn his reputation by proving himself trustworthy.

meanings.sent1: She needed to reearn the money she spent on the new car.
meanings.sent2: He hoped to reearn the investment he made in the stock market.
meanings.sent3: The business had to reearn the profits lost during the slow season.
meanings.sent4: They planned to reearn the funds through a successful fundraising event.
meanings.sent5: The company aimed to reearn its losses by increasing sales.
